articles.title: Kim Jong Il Congratulates General Secretary of LPRP
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Congratulates General Secretary of LPRP
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Monday sent a congratulatory message to Choummaly Saynasone on his reelection as general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP).
					 The message said:
					
					 I warmly congratulate you on your reelection as general secretary of the LPRP Central Committee at its 9th Congress.
					
					 Your reelection is an expression of the deep trust of all the party members and people in you.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I express belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the WPK and the LPRP established in the anti-imperialist common struggle for socialism will grow stronger in conformity with the desire of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 I wish you greater success in your responsible work for building prosperous Laos.

articles.title: Foreign Ministry Spokesman Denounces US Military Attack on Libya
articles.content:
Foreign Ministry Spokesman Denounces US Military Attack on Libya
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA Tuesday as regards the U.S. military attack on Libya:
					 The U.S. launched a military attack on Libya in collusion with some Western countries on March 19.
					
					 It openly interfered in the internal affairs of Libya, sparking off a civil war, and then cooked up a deceptive resolution by abusing the authority of the UN Security Council. It finally perpetrated indiscriminate armed intervention in the country, going beyond the limits of the resolution.
					
					 The DPRK strongly denounces this as a wanton violation of the sovereignty and territorial integrity of an independent state and a hideous crime against humanity in gross breach of the dignity of the Libyan people and their right to existence.
					
					 Such war action can never be justified and should be halted at once.
					
					 The world is witnessing almost everyday the miserable death of a great many peaceable citizens and unspeakable disasters caused by two wars launched by the U.S. in the new century.
					
					 Not content with this, the U.S. sparked a fresh war disaster in order to bring about a regime change in the country incurring its displeasure under the spurious signboard of "protecting civilians" and put the natural resources of Libya under its control.
					
					 The U.S. does not hesitate to interfere in the internal affairs of other countries and launch armed invasion by abusing the UN name in disregard of the sovereignty of independent states. Such high-handed and arbitrary practices of the U.S. have become a root cause of harassing world peace and stability at present.
					
					 The present Libyan crisis teaches the international community a serious lesson.
					
					 It was fully exposed before the world that "Libya's nuclear dismantlement" much touted by the U.S. in the past turned out to be a mode of aggression whereby the latter coaxed the former with such sweet words as "guarantee of security" and "improvement of relations" to disarm itself and then swallowed it up by force.
					
					 It proved once again the truth of history that peace can be preserved only when one builds up one's own strength as long as high-handed and arbitrary practices go on in the world.
					
					 The DPRK was quite just when it took the path of Songun and the military capacity for self-defence built up in this course serves as a very valuable deterrent for averting a war and defending peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Pakistani President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Pakistani President 
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Asif Ali Zardari, president of Pakistan, on the occasion of the day of Pakistan. 
					Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop favorably, the message wished the President and the people of Pakistan greater success in the work for development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Pakistani PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Pakistani PM
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Choe Yong Rim on Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Syed Yousuf Raja Gilani, prime minister of Pakistan, on the occasion of the day of Pakistan. 
					Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow stronger in different fields, the message wished the Prime Minister and the people of Pakistan greater successes in the work for the independent development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Gets Familiar with Vegetable Production
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Gets Familiar with Vegetable Production 
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Choe Yong Rim acquainted himself with the production of vegetables in the city of Pyongyang while visiting the Mangyongdae Vegetable Farm, the Chilgol Vegetable Farm and the Rihyon Vegetable Cooperative Farm.    
					 The premier called a consultative meeting of officials concerned after learning about the farms' preparations for farming and the operation of water pumping set-ups.
					
					 The meeting underlined the important duties of the vegetable farms in improving the citizens' diet. It discussed practical matters of decisively increasing the vegetable production this year. 
					
					 The meeting called on the Cabinet and other related units to take specific measures for preferentially and timely supplying power for water pumps and farming materials badly needed for cultivating vegetables.

articles.title: KPA Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
KPA Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean People's Army headed by Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, left Pyongyang by air Tuesday to visit Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia.

articles.title: Youth League Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Youth League Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League headed by Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of its Central Committee, left Pyongyang Tuesday by air to visit Vietnam.

articles.title: Swiss Businessmen Arrive
articles.content:
Swiss Businessmen Arrive
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Reto Wittwer, president of the Swiss Kempinski Hotel Group, and his party arrived here on Tuesday by air.

articles.title: Japanese Personage Here
articles.content:
Japanese Personage Here
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Takashi Nada, representative of the Ehime Institute for Contemporary Korean Issue in Japan who is chairman of the Ehime Prefectural Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung, arrived here by air on Tuesday.

articles.title: DPRK Directs Much Effort to Management of Water Resources
articles.content:
DPRK Directs Much Effort to Management of Water Resources
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government has paid deep attention to making an effective use of water resources.
					 Based on the laws on water resources and national land planning, it has protected and developed water resources, steadily increasing investment in this field.
					
					 Reservoirs and hydraulic power stations have been built in areas with a large amount of precipitation and upper streams abundant in water resources to operate a rational water control system throughout the country. 
					
					 The Kaechon-Lake Thaesong Waterway, Paekma-Cholsan Waterway and other gravity-fed waterways bring water to agricultural fields.
					
					 Water and flood forecasting systems are available for all streams and reservoirs and an early warning system is working in the country to prevent disasters.
					
					 In spring and autumn, the government concentrates on land management, including tree planting and river improvement. It has also put the water resources management on an IT basis. 
					
					 A program for the environment protection of the River Taedong, one of the country's major streams, has already been worked out. 
					
					 Information activities for protection and management of the water resources have also been conducted in a diverse way.
					
					 Meanwhile, the government has cooperated with such international organization as the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations for the management of water resources.

articles.title: World Water Day Observed
articles.content:
World Water Day Observed
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- An event on the theme of "Water and Urbanization" took place at the Grand People's Study House on Tuesday on the occasion of World Water Day.
					 Present there were officials of the State Planning Commission, the Ministry of Urban Management, the Ministry of Land and Environmental Conservation, the Education Commission, the Grand People's Study House and the Pyongyang City People's Committee, etc. and the representative and staff members of the UNICEF office here and other foreign guests.
					
					 Lectures were given at the event.
					
					 Lecturers referred to the successes made by the Korean people in the work to preserve and manage water resources.
					
					 They underscored the need to make positive efforts to preserve clean drinking water with a deep understanding of importance of water and protection of water resources.
					
					 The participants watched the Korean scientific film "Gravity-fed Water Supply".
					
					 On the same day, hygienic information service of students was conducted at the Hero Anju Secondary School No. 1 on the above-said occasion.
					
					 Officials and members of the DPRK Red Cross Society, members of the delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies active in the DPRK were on hand.
					
					 Earlier, the participants went round the water supply system built with the aid of the Federation.

articles.title: Ponghwa Revolutionary Site Visited by Crowds of Soldiers and People
articles.content:
Ponghwa Revolutionary Site Visited by Crowds of Soldiers and People
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Ponghwa Revolutionary Site in Kangdong County, Pyongyang, was visited by large crowds of servicepersons, working people and school youth and children on the occasion of the 94th anniversary of the Korean National Association.
					 This place is associated with the immortal exploits Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter, performed by organizing and leading the anti-Japanese national liberation struggle from the middle of March 1916 to November 1917. 
					
					 The visitors went round different places including a house, the place on Mt. Ponghwa where a secret meeting was held, the Monument to Pisoko-gye and the Maekjon Ferry. 
					
					 They looked round historical mementoes and materials at the Ponghwa-ri Revolutionary Museum while being briefed on the fact that he formed the KNA and conducted energetic activities to expand its organizations to vast areas at home and abroad.

articles.title: Amusements Available at People's Palace of Culture
articles.content:
Amusements Available at People's Palace of Culture
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The People's Palace of Culture located on the banks of the Pothong River in Pyongyang is always crowed with people enjoying amusements.
					 It has a table-tennis hall and folk amusement facilities in the second floor.
					
					 What is most popular in the folk amusements is Korean chess.
					
					 The palace also has soft-drink stands and public baths for visitors.

articles.title: Song Selected for Taekwon-Do Championship
articles.content:
Song Selected for Taekwon-Do Championship
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Organizing Committee of the 17th World Taekwon-Do Championship selected "Pyongyang Taekwon-Do Festival Song" as the song of the championship. 
					 The festival song was created for the 8th World Taekwon-Do Championship held in Pyongyang in September Juche 81 (1992).
					
					 The song reflects the unanimous will of the Taekwon-do players across the world to safeguard justice and peace and achieve unity and development.    
					
					 The committee also fixed justice, peace, friendship and unity as the idea of the championship.
					
					 The 17th championship is scheduled to be held in the DPRK in September.

articles.title: Koguryo Tombs with Mural Paintings
articles.content:
Koguryo Tombs with Mural Paintings
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Mural paintings of Koguryo tombs, registered as a world cultural heritage, provide a glimpse of Korean painting.
					 Korean painting portrays diverse feelings and stirrings of people with a peculiar brush.
					
					 The mural paintings prove that the art of Korean painting was already established in the period of Koguryo kingdom.
					
					 Typical of mural tombs are Anak Tomb No. 3 in Oguk-ri, Anak County, South Hwanghae Province and the Kangso Tomb.
					
					 The mural paintings of Koguryo tombs reflect the traditional character of Korean painting in color and intensive and implicit depiction, too.

articles.title: Football Prodigy of DPRK
articles.content:
Football Prodigy of DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Hwang Jong Hyang, an 11-year-old girl belonging to Taedonggang District Juvenile Sports School, is drawing attention of football experts in the DPRK.
					 She is very speedy, flexible and quick in understanding.
					
					 She is also good in dribbling.
					
					 The fourth-year pupil of primary school has a well-proportioned figure suitable for football.

articles.title: Jong Ju Yong Remembered
articles.content:
Jong Ju Yong Remembered 
						
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a verbal personal message in memory of Jong Ju Yong, former honorary chairman of the Hyundai Group of south Korea, on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of his death.
					 He said in the message that Jong Ju Yong paved the way for national reconciliation and cooperation and did really a great job for the development of the inter-Korean relations and the sacred cause of national reunification.
					
					 The fellow countrymen look back on the noble life of Jong who found a true patriotic road thanks to the boundless loving care and trust of Kim Jong Il, the peerlessly great man, and made the remaining years of his life shine.
					
					 Jong made up his mind to devote himself to the country and the nation even in the remainder of his life though he was engrossed in accumulating capital and expanding his business all his life. 
					
					 He made his utmost efforts to pave the way for inter-Korean economic cooperation despite all sorts of accusations and obstructions by anti-reunification forces. 
					
					 It was against this background that he visited the DPRK. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il met him in October 1998 and fully supported the orientation of his work for inter-Korean cooperation and exchange. 
					
					 Jong was completely attracted by his personality as a great man the moment he was received by the leader. He more energetically devoted himself to the patriotic work for reunification. He commenced the voyage of the first tourist ship in the East Sea in November of that year, thus paving the way for inter-Korean economic cooperation. 
					
					 In his address made at the ceremony held to mark the departure of the ship he said that the day was significant as it marked the beginning of the large-scale exchange of people between the south and the north and he hoped this would provide an opportunity to reenergize the south-north reconciliation and economic cooperation. 
					
					 In 1999, he made sure that basketball games for reunification took place in the north and the south. 
					
					 He dedicated himself to the north-south economic cooperation till the last moments of his life on March 21, 2001 with the particular pride and honor of being the first businessman among the south Korean tycoons ever to meet Kim Jong Il and being received by him several times.
					
					 The south Korean people are now turning out in the actions for the improved inter-Korean relations, national reconciliation and cooperation and national reunification despite all challenges of the anti-reunification forces, following the example set by Jong.

articles.title: Wall Mirror, Gift from Jordanian Political Figure
articles.content:
Wall Mirror, Gift from Jordanian Political Figure
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Exhibited at the International Friendship Exhibition House of the DPRK is a wall mirror sent to General Secretary Kim Jong Il by Marwan Sudah, a prominent political figure of Jordan.
					 Before his second visit to Korea, he prepared the gift with the help of an expert.
					
					 The rectangular, double frame of the mirror is decorated with embroidered cloth in both sides and in the lower part.
					
					 The arch-style mirror symbolizes a triumphal arch to be passed by Arabs after winning the victory in their cause. 
					
					 Red color of the cloth means their desire and victory and green color signifies agriculture and rich harvest. The flower and geometrical decorations of the cloth are their traditional patterns.
					
					 When visiting Pyongyang, he asked an official concerned to convey the gift to the DPRK leader, saying he was very pleased to present the gift to him.

articles.title: Self-Reliance Spirit of Korean People
articles.content:
Self-Reliance Spirit of Korean People
 Pyongyang, March 22 (CKNA) -- The independence and prosperity of a country should be achieved by its own people -- this is the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance and work President Kim Il Sung provided to the Korean people.
					 The spirit originated from the spirit of Yanji bomb created by him at an arsenal in a forest during the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 He inspirited the anti-Japanese fighters with the spirit of Yanji bomb.
					
					 After the liberation of the country the Korean people fully displayed the spirit of self-reliance in the Pothong river improvement project.
					
					 Addressing the starting ceremony of the project on May 21, Juche 35 (1946), he said the Korean people should finish the project by themselves, not hoping for others' help but overcoming all difficulties.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists failed to finish the project in ten years though they mobilized three million people. But Korean people successfully completed the huge project in nearly two months.
					
					 In the spirit of self-reliance they carried out the industrialization of the country in only 14 years and built the West Sea Barrage in five years under the leadership of the President.
					
					 It is also thanks to the spirit that the country launched satellites and built up a nuclear deterrent.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts Protracted US-S. Korea Military Exercises
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts Protracted US-S. Korea Military Exercises
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S.-south Korea joint military maneuvers, Foal Eagle, are assuming protracted nature.
					 Foal Eagle, large field mobile exercises aimed at invading the DPRK, was reported to go on till late in April though Key Resolve was over. This is arousing serious concern among the members of the international community. 
					
					 As already known to the public, Foal Eagle is a comprehensive drill for a preemptive nuclear attack to realize the ambition for invading the DPRK after igniting an all-out war through surprise attacks on strategic targets in its depth and its main bases. 
					
					 This protracted nature of the on-going saber-rattling proves its bellicose nature, above all. 
					
					 In the past U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises were staged according to OPLAN 5027 under the pretence of coping with someone's "invasion of the south." But, this year's saber-rattling is underway according to OPLAN 5029 mainly under the pretext of coping with "contingency".
					
					 OPLAN 5029 is a very dangerous war scenario as it classifies somebody's "contingency" into six categories and calls on the U.S. and south Korean warmongers "to go over to a military intervention" in case of "contingency." 
					
					 The on-going saber-rattling cannot be interpreted otherwise than very dangerous war maneuvers for mounting a three-dimensional surprise attack on the DPRK with all means including nukes involved under the pretext of coping with "contingency". 
					
					 The above-said protracted war maneuvers are aimed, to all intents and purposes, to steadily escalate the pressure upon the DPRK and the military tension to realize the scenario of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces to start a war of aggression against it.
					
					 The situation remains so tense on the Korean Peninsula that a war may break out anytime due to the arrogant aggressors who respond to the positive efforts of the DPRK for dialogue and peace with war maneuvers. 
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean authorities will never evade the responsibility for this grave situation. 
					
					 The war maniacs should never miscalculate. It is a daydream for them to seek to hurt the DPRK through war exercises.

articles.title: Protracted Foal Eagle Is Prelude to US War of Aggression on DPRK
articles.content:
Protracted Foal Eagle Is Prelude to US War of Aggression on DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The United States kicked off with south Korea the Foal Eagle joint military rehearsal on February 28 which will last till April 30. This is the largest- and longest-ever joint military maneuvers in the history of U.S.-south Korea joint saber-rattling as its period is 39 days longer than what was staged last year. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard: 
					
					 The above-said joint military exercises are a prelude to the U.S. war of aggression on the DPRK. 
					
					 Through the longest-ever exercises the U.S. seeks to create a favorable environment for igniting a new war. It also schemes to mount a surprise preemptive attack on the DPRK under the pretext of someone's "provocation" during the exercises. 
					
					 The grave situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula once again goes to prove that the U.S. prefers war to dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 The danger of the second Korean war is increasing on the peninsula every hour due to the U.S. strategy for a war of aggression on the DPRK, the strategy that has entered the phase of its full-scale implementation.
					
					 The U.S. is, however, seriously mistaken. 
					
					 It is the tradition and firm faith of the revolutionary army of the DPRK to reliably protect its sovereignty and peace in Korea with arms. 
					
					 The U.S. persistent reckless moves for a war of aggression on the DPRK would only precipitate its shameful fiasco.

articles.title: US Termed World's Worst Human Rights Abuser
articles.content:
US Termed World's Worst Human Rights Abuser
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) ? It was recently disclosed that the U.S. used prisoners of Guantanamo prison as guinea pigs for tests on living bodies, sparking off bitter anger of the international community.
					 The German newspaper Berliner Zeitung, conveying account of an interview with a Turkish-German released from the prison after his more than four years' imprisonment, disclosed that the U.S. regularly conducted those tests on the prisoners there. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The above-said human rights abuses are a challenge and insult to mankind which calls for respecting human rights.
					
					 The universally recognized international law bans torture inflicting sufferings upon human beings. 
					
					 Under the signboard of "anti-terror war" the U.S. has kept behind bars those who are not POWs for several years without any trial on charges of being "terrorists" in violation of the universally recognized international law and war law and regulations. It is not only putting them to unbearable torture but using them as guinea pigs. 
					
					The U.S. is apt to advocate "protection of human rights." But it does not hesitate to invade sovereign countries and kill innocent people under the pretext of "anti-terror war."
					
					 The above-said facts go to clearly prove that the U.S. is the heinous criminal that abuses human rights without any hesitation.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to stop at once such criminal acts against humanity as infringing upon state sovereignty and abusing human rights under the pretext of "human rights issues".

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Repeal War Policy
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Repeal War Policy
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The escalating tension in the Korean Peninsula is consequent on the south Korean authorities' treacherous moves to ignite a war against the DPRK. They worked in collusion with foreign forces in utter disregard of the peaceful reunification of the country and the destiny of the nation.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a by-lined article.
					
					 The tension is a product of the south Korean authorities' war policy and a clear proof of their criminal ambition to escalate confrontation of systems which calls for denying the idea and system of the DPRK, the article notes, citing facts to prove this.
					
					 It is the consistent stand and policy of the DPRK to ensure peace in the peninsula and achieve the peaceful reunification of the country, the article says, adding:
					
					 If either the north or the south tries to enforce one's own system upon the other side, it will naturally lead to confrontation and war.
					
					The south Korean authorities put up "no nuke, opening and 3000 dollars" as their "policy toward the DPRK". This is aimed to force the DPRK to disarm itself and allure it into "reform and opening" and thus realize "unification under liberal democratic system". The chief executive of south Korea, too, openly said that it is his "dream and ultimate goal."
					
					 The ongoing U.S.-south Korea joint military drills proved once again that the south Korean authorities seek confrontation of systems and "unification of systems", not dialogue and peace.
					
					 The south Korean authorities turned the biggest joint military maneuvers into a test war for doing harm to the DPRK's dignified system by force. This shows that their ambition for "unification of systems" reached an extremely dangerous stage.
					
					 If the tension in the peninsula is to be defused it is necessary for the south Korean authorities to make a switchover in their confrontation policy and stop the war provocations against the DPRK as demanded by all Koreans.

articles.title: Verbal Message in Memory of Jong Ju Yong Conveyed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Verbal Message in Memory of Jong Ju Yong Conveyed in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- KBS of south Korea on March 19 reported the news that leader Kim Jong Il sent a verbal personal message in memory of Jong Ju Yong, former honorary chairman of the Hyundai Group of south Korea, on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of his death. 
					 It said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, noted in the message that Jong Ju Yong paved the way for national reconciliation and cooperation and did really a great job for the development of the inter-Korean relations and the sacred cause of national reunification.
					
					 He prayed for the happiness of Jong Ju Yong and hoped that everything would go well in the family of Hyundai.

articles.title: Poor Health Conditions in S. Korea, Product of Unpopular Rule
articles.content:
Poor Health Conditions in S. Korea, Product of Unpopular Rule
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Seoul National University Hospital, the Severance Hospital and other hospitals in south Korea were recently disclosed to have conducted clinical tests on patients without guarantee of their lives. The story stunned the people. 
					 Such illegal acts clearly indicate the poor health conditions of the south Korean society where money is everything. 
					
					 The poor are denied hospital treatment in south Korea with medical treatment fees steadily rising. 
					
					 A general medical check-up costs 100-400 U.S. dollars. Hospital charges a day in big hospitals of Seoul are estimated at 100-300 U.S. dollars on average. 
					
					 In 2009 when bird flu swept across south Korea hospitals demanded 200,000 won for one medical examination. 
					
					 After the emergence of the present "government" the number of infection cases at hospitals reached 300,000 a year and the ensuing yearly mortality rate 15,000. 
					
					 The poor suffer from all kinds of diseases as they can hardly get timely treatment. 
					
					 Such poor health conditions of south Korea are an inevitable product of the unpopular rule by the puppet authorities. 
					
					 All facts go to prove that the healthy life of the south Korean people is unthinkable as long as the present puppet authorities are allowed to stay in power.

articles.title: Books Published Abroad to Commemorate Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Books Published Abroad to Commemorate Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung
						
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Russia and Bulgaria published books commemorating the centenary of birth of President           Kim Il Sung. 
					 Lyudmila Abzeyeva, member of the Russian Union of Writers, and Natalia Belokopytova, member of the "Working Russia" Movement, wrote books "Eternal Sun of Hope" and "Korea in Kim Jong Il's Era".
					
					They spoke highly of the ideo-theoretical feats, wise leadership and noble virtues of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il who built a socialist power demonstrating its dignity and invincibility on the strength of the Songun politics and single-minded unity.
					
					 The world people call the present era Kim Jong Il's era and praise him as the most prominent statesman in the 21st century as he opened the new era of building a thriving nation while frustrating every move of the imperialists to stifle the DPRK, the books said. They also introduced the reality of Songun Korea making long strides. 
					
					 Georgi Anastasov, former rector of Kim Il Sung School of Bulgaria, authored book "President Kim Il Sung, Kind Father" while Pencho Kubadinski, former chairman of the National Council of Fatherland Front of Bulgaria, "Led by the Great Man in the 21st Century".
					
					 They tell about the peerlessly great man's undying historic stories associated with Bulgaria, praising Kim Il Sung as the sun of humankind to be remembered long by all people.
					
					 Bulgarian writer Atanas Ivanov in "Songun Politics" (Vol. 2) of book "Distant Yet Close Korea" cited facts to show that thanks to the unique Songun politics and superb diplomacy of Kim Jong Il the army and people of the DPRK have won only victories in the political and military stand-off with the U.S. imperialists and their followers.

articles.title: President Kim Il Sung Praised
articles.content:
President Kim Il Sung Praised
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain posted on Internet homepage an article commemorating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The article said that the President is the great leader whom the Korean people acclaimed for the first time in Korea's history spanning thousands of years and the sun of Juche alive in the hearts of mankind.
					
					 The Day of the Sun, April 15, is the greatest holiday when the Korean people greeted the sun of Juche, the father of socialist Korea, and the significant day on which a broad avenue of independence, development and eternal prosperity was opened for the Korean people, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The dignity and honor of Kim Il Sung's nation, the invincible might of Songun Korea and the bright future of human cause of independence would have been unthinkable without the Day of the Sun.
					
					 The DPRK could record the heroic epic of epoch-making creation and innovations as it advanced under the banner of the Juche idea led by the President.
					
					 His cause is being successfully carried forward thanks to the experienced and tested leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Socialist Korea shines as the homeland of Songun and the beacon of hope for progressive mankind under the distinguished leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Nepalese Paper on Socio-Historical Conditions of Founding Songun Idea
articles.content:
Nepalese Paper on Socio-Historical Conditions of Founding Songun Idea
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese paper Arpan on March 11 carried an article titled "Socio-historical conditions of founding Songun idea".
					 The paper in the article said that the Korean nation's tragedy early in the 20th century when the country was usurped by the Japanese imperialists taught a lesson that a nation without powerful army can not avoid the fate of slave.
					
					 The Songun idea reflected the socio-historical conditions at that time when the Korean revolution was faced with the main task to defeat the Japanese imperialists and liberate the country and the nation, the article said.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung founded the Songun idea, keenly realizing that only armed struggle would help liberate Korea and advance the revolution, the article added.

articles.title: Damage by Radioactivity, Quake and Tsunami Increases in Japan
articles.content:
Damage by Radioactivity, Quake and Tsunami Increases in Japan 
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The radiation caused by the explosions of nuclear reactors in the wake of the killer quake that hit Japan and the ensuing tsunami is becoming a serious problem. 
					 On Monday the Tokyo Electric Power Co. announced that it detected radioactive iodine six times the normal level and cesium from the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant. 
					
					 The Japanese Asahi Shimbun said these materials are typical substances being churned out in the course of nuclear fission, making it clear that nuclear fuel has been damaged. 
					
					 Radioactive substances were detected from drinking water in Tokyo, Chiba, Niigata and six other prefectures on the same day. 
					
					 On March 19, foods contaminated by radiation were found in Fukushima and Ibaraki prefectures.
					
					 Fire broke out at Reactors No. 2 and No. 3 of the plant on Monday. 
					
					 In the meantime, the human and material losses caused by quake and the ensuing tsunami are on the steady increase. 
					
					The National Police Agency of Japan said that the death toll reached 9,079 and 12,654 were reported missing as of noon of Tuesday.
					
					 Many factories and infrastructures were seriously destroyed and factories of Toyota, Nissan and Sony companies, the major business groups in the eastern region, stopped production due to the shortage of electricity. 
					
					 An acute shortage of petrol and agricultural products is driving the daily life of inhabitants into confusion. 
					
					 Media of Japan said that it is hard to improve such situation at an early date and economic recovery would be considerably difficult. 
					
					 Aftershocks are taking place one after another. 
					
					 On March 19, a magnitude 6.1 quake rattled the area of Kanto. The epicenter was 20 kilometers underground in the northern part of Ibaragi Prefecture.

articles.title: Cuba Decries West's Wrong Attitude to Human Rights Issue
articles.content:
Cuba Decries West's Wrong Attitude to Human Rights Issue
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Cuban delegate blamed the West for its wrong approach to human rights issue when addressing a session of the UN Human Rights Council on March 18. 
					 The Western countries attempt to convert the UN Human Rights Council into a kind of court of trying developing countries, while talking about the weakness of the Council, he said. He blamed them for trying to expand the immunity as for their human rights abuses. 
					
					 He denounced the United States, Israel and other Western countries for killing innocent women and children of other countries, claiming legality. He also condemned them for keeping mum about the secret prisons in Europe.

articles.title: SCO Defense Ministerial Meeting Held
articles.content:
SCO Defense Ministerial Meeting Held
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- A meeting of defense ministers of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) member nations was held in Astana, Kazakhstan on March 17. 
					 Present there were defense ministers of Russia, China, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan and Kazakhstan and SCO representatives.
					
					 The meeting exchanged views on the issue of developing the military cooperation among member nations and on international and regional matters of mutual concern. 
					
					 At the end of the meeting a communique was made public and a 2012-2013 cooperation plan signed.

articles.title: Kazakh President Visits Russia
articles.content:
Kazakh President Visits Russia
Moscow, March 20 (KCNA) -- Nursultan Nazarbayev, Kazakh President, visited Russia on March 17.
					 During his stay he had a talk with Russian President Dmitri Medvedev and conversed with Prime Minister Vladimir Putin.
					
					 At the talk and conversation they exchanged views on the issue of boosting the bilateral economic cooperation including the formation of unitary economic space and on international matters of mutual concern.

articles.title: India Orders Review of Nuclear Safety System
articles.content:
India Orders Review of Nuclear Safety System
						
 New Delhi, March 20 (KCNA) -- Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh said that India has ordered a review of safety systems of all its nuclear plants to ensure they withstand "large natural disasters" like tsunamis and earthquakes. 
					 "The government attaches the highest importance to nuclear safety," Singh added. 
					
					 The measure has been taken by the requests of the Indian nuclear experts in the wake of explosions of nuclear reactors in Japan.

articles.title: Belorussian President Expects Single Economic Space
articles.content:
Belorussian President Expects Single Economic Space 
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Aleksandr Lukashenko, President of Belarus, expressed expectation for the single economic space in a conversation with Russian Prime Minister Putin on Mar. 15.
					 He said that Belarus has great expectation for it as it considers that this has a bright prospect.

articles.title: Eurogroup President Warns against Inflationary Risk
articles.content:
Eurogroup President Warns against Inflationary Risk
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The Eurogroup President told about the danger of inflation of the bloc at a recent press conference.
					 "On inflation there has been a significant increase, reflecting the increase of the price of commodities," he said, adding: We will continue to follow the situation very closely.

articles.title: China Takes Measure to Prevent Forest Fires
articles.content:
China Takes Measure to Prevent Forest Fires
 Beijing, March 20 (KCNA) -- The State Council of China called a video and telephone conference on Mar. 15 at which it issued instructions to prevent forest fires during the 12th Five-Year Plan and in 2011. 
					 Hui Liangyu, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party and vice-premier of China, at the conference underlined the need for the relevant regions and fields across the country to regard this work as a basic process for building ecological civilization, part of people's life to promote the harmony of society and a process to cope with the climate change and steadily carry it out under a scientific plan.

articles.title: China's Drive to Save Energy
articles.content:
China's Drive to Save Energy
 Beijing, March 20 (KCNA) -- China directed efforts to saving energy in the period of the 11th Five-Year Plan. As a result, its average annual energy saving capacity increased at least 13 million tons, when calculated in terms of standard coal. 
					 The number of energy saving service companies swelled to more than 800 last year from over 80 in 2005.

articles.title: Regulations on Road Safety Issued in China
articles.content:
Regulations on Road Safety Issued in China 
 Beijing, March 20 (KCNA) -- China issued regulations on road safety on Mar. 14.
					 Their purpose is to strengthen the work to protect roads and ensure the best shape of roads and safe traffic there.
					
					 The regulations call on the department in charge of transport of the State Council to supervise the work for protecting roads across the country in a responsible manner.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia mensaje a Choummaly Saynasone
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia mensaje a Choummaly Saynasone
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, envio el dia 21 un mensaje de felicitacion a Choummaly Saynasone, secretario general del Comite Central del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao, por su reeleccion a este cargo.
					  La misiva senala como sigue:
					
					  Felicito calidamente a Usted por su reeleccion como secretario general del CC del PPRL en el 9o congreso de este partido.
					
					  Su reeleccion en ese cargo importante es una expresion de la gran confianza de todos los militantes de su partido y los habitantes depositada en Usted.
					
					  Convencido de que las magnificas relaciones de amistad y cooperacion establecidas entre nuestros dos partidos en la lucha conjunta antiimperialista y por el socialismo se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas en el futuro conforme al deseo de los pueblos de ambos paises, aprovecho esta oportunidad para desearle mayores exitos en su trabajo responsable para construir un Laos prospero.

articles.title: MINREX denuncia ataque militar de EE.UU. contra Libia
articles.content:
MINREX denuncia ataque militar de EE.UU. contra Libia
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ATCC) -- Con respecto al inicio de ataque militar de Estados Unidos contra Libia, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dio el dia 22 la siguiente respuesta a la ATCC:
					El dia 19, Estados Unidos comenzo el ataque armado contra Libia en colaboracion con algunos paises occidentales. 
					
					EE.UU. suscito una rebelion interna interviniendo abiertamente en los asuntos internos de Libia y fabrico una resolucion fraudulenta abusando de la facultad del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU.
					
					Al fin y al cabo, inicio la indiscriminada intervencion militar sobrepasando el limite de esa resolucion. 
					
					La RPDC la condena categoricamente considerandola como violacion flagrante de la soberania e integridad territorial de ese Estado soberano y peor crimen de lesa humanidad que pisotea la dignidad y el derecho a la vida de su pueblo. 
					
					Estas acciones de guerra no pueden ser justificadas en ningun caso sino deben ser paradas inmediatamente. 
					
					Todo el mundo ve todos los dias como muchos civiles pacificos pierden la vida o sufren indecibles desastres debido a las dos guerras desatadas por EE.UU. en el nuevo siglo. 
					
					Insatisfecho con eso, EE.UU. desato la nueva guerra con el fin de sustituir con fuerzas armadas el poder, que no le gusta, bajo el rotulo vistoso de "proteccion de civiles" y apoderarse de recursos naturales de ese pais. 
					
					El despotismo y las arbitrariedades de EE.UU., que practica sin vacilacion alguna la intervencion en los asuntos internos y la invasion armada, abusando de la insignia de la ONU y despreciando el poder de Estado soberano, devienen hoy la causa de perturbacion de la paz y estabilidad del mundo. 
					
					La situacion actual de Libia ensena una seria leccion a la sociedad internacional. 
					
					Se ha revelado claramente a todo el mundo que el "modo de renuncia nuclear de Libia", de que hablaba tanto EE.UU. en el pasado, es el modo de agresion para desarmar al rival con palabras agradables como "garantizar la seguridad y el mejoramiento de relaciones" y atacarlo despues con armas. 
					
					Se ha confirmado otra vez la verdad de la historia de que es posible preservar la paz solo con las fuerzas propias mientras existan en el globo terraqueo el despotismo y las arbitrariedades. 
					
					Es muy justo el camino del Songun optado por nuestro pueblo. Y el disuasivo de autodefensa nacional preparado en virtud del Songun es el muy valioso para frenar la guerra y defender la paz y estabilidad en la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: Jong Ju Yong fue explorador de cooperacion nacional
articles.content:
Jong Ju Yong fue explorador de cooperacion nacional
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 10o aniversario de deceso del ex presidente honorario del Grupo Hyundai del Sur de Corea, Jong Ju Yong, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il envio un mensaje oral evaluando que el allano el camino de reconciliacion y cooperacion nacionales e hizo gran aporte al desarrollo de las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas y a la sagrada causa de reunificacion de la patria.
					Esta grabada en la memoria de la nacion la honrosa vida de Jong, quien encontro la verdadera via de patriotismo bajo el gran amor y confianza del Gran Hombre sin par y glorifico en ese camino sus ultimos anos de vida.
					
					Jong, quien vivio toda su vida por la acumulacion del capital y la ampliacion de sus negocios, decidio trabajar en la etapa final de su vida por el pais y la nacion.
					
					En medio de difamaciones y acciones obstruccionistas de las fuerzas anti-reunificacion, se esforzo ingentemente por allanar el camino de cooperacion economica Norte-Sur. 
					
					En octubre de 1998, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il se reunio con Jong cuando este hizo una visita a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y apoyo el rumbo de su trabajo hacia la cooperacion y el intercambio entre ambas partes coreanas. 
					
					A la primera vista, Jong quedo totalmente fascinado de las nobles cualidades del Dirigente.
					
					Desde ese encuentro, Jong trabajo con mas energia y logro en noviembre de ese ano dar inicio a la cooperacion economica N-S al mandar el primer barco de turistas al monte Kumgang por via del mar Este. 
					
					En el discurso pronunciado en la ceremonia de partida del barco, Jong dijo asi: "Hoy es el dia significativo en que se inicia el intercambio humano de gran dimension entre el Sur y el Norte y deseo que esto contribuya a dinamizar la reconciliacion y la cooperacion economica Sur-Norte".
					
					En 1999, posibilito auspiciar los juegos de baloncesto en el Norte y el Sur. 
					
					Jong fue el primero de los plutocratas surcoreanos en ser recibido varias veces por el Dirigente. 
					
					Fallecio el 21 de marzo de 2001.
					
					Siguiendo el ejemplo de el, los habitantes surcoreanos se levantan hoy en la causa por la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas, la reconciliacion y cooperacion nacionales y la reunificacion de la patria rechazando los desafios de toda indole de las fuerzas anti-reunificacion.

articles.title: Elegida cancion del XVII Campeonato Mundial de Taekwondo
articles.content:
Elegida cancion del XVII Campeonato Mundial de Taekwondo
Pyongyang, 22 de marzo (ATCC) -- El comite organizador del XVII Campeonato Mundial de Taekwondo determino la "Cancion del festival de Taekwondo de Pyongyang" como la cancion de ese evento programado para septiembre en esta capital.
					  La cancion fue creada durante la octava edicion del mismo festival transcurrida en Pyongyang en septiembre del 81 (1992) de la Era Juche.
					
					  Refleja la voluntad unanime de los taekwondoistas de todo el mundo de defender la justicia y la paz y lograr la unidad y el desarrollo.
					
					  Por otra parte, el comite organizador definio la justicia, la paz, la amistad y la solidaridad como ideal del inminente campeonato.
